benchmark_details.name: LONG MEMEVAL
benchmark_details.overview: LONG MEMEVAL is a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate five core long-term memory abilities of chat assistants: information extraction, multi-session reasoning, temporal reasoning, knowledge updates, and abstention, consisting of 500 meticulously curated questions embedded within freely scalable user-assistant chat histories.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to assess the long-term memory capabilities of chat assistants across five core memory tasks: information extraction, multi-session reasoning, temporal reasoning, knowledge updates, and abstention.

data.source: Manually created questions testing long-term memory abilities based on user-assistant dialogue interactions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the correctness of answers provided by chat assistants compared to the curated answers.
methodology.interpretation: Good performance is indicated by high accuracy in responding correctly to the benchmark questions.
methodology.validation: Long MEMEVAL has been validated through extensive experimental evaluations against commercial systems and long-context LLMs.
